reference.shortdesc: A key definition provides a simple way to define a key without making the definition itself a part of rendered content.

section.title: Usage information

div.p: The keydef element is a convenience element. It is equivalent to a topicref element with processing-role set to resource-only.
Attributes defaulted on the keydef element ensure that key definitions do not appear in tables of contents, do not add extra links, and are not rendered as topics.

section.p: The key definition component is a convenience component. It is equivalent to a topic reference component element with processing-role set to resource-only. Attributes defaulted on the key definition component ensure that key definitions do not appear in the TOC, do not add extra links, and are not rendered as topics.

sectiondiv.p: The following attributes are available on this element: , , , , keys, and keyref.
The following attributes are available on this element: (with a narrowed definition of href, given below), , , class, and outputclass.

On this element:
keys is a required attribute.
processing-role has a default value of resource-only.
href might be omitted, such as when the key definition is intended for variable text.
